Posts.Title: Oncotype test - too small IDC to test? kimag Lilac17

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2013 08:52AM kathy1925 wrote: I was diagnosed 3 years ago with DCIS grade 3 in the right breast, and IDC grade 1 (4mm) in the left breast, so my stage is 1A. I had a double mastectomy, with sentinel nodes removed from both sides. No radiation, no chemo (oncotype 9), and I am on Arimidex for 5 years. I have just now been "promoted" to seeing the breast surgeon only annually, and the oncologist semi-annually. I had a scare a few months ago, with some frightening symptoms (pain, constant headaches) and the onc ordered a Pet Scan (my first one) and a brain MRI. Thankfully, they were both clear. Aside from that, the screening consists of a manual exam by the surgeon and the onc. I consider myself very fortunate to have caught the cancer at such an early stage.
Posts.Title: <1 cm - Stage 1a - Team 4My3kids rosecal954

Posts.Content: Jul 10, 2016 10:25AM kathy1925 wrote: 100% ER, 95% PR 6 years NED
Posts.Title: What percentage ER+ and how many years NED? TectonicShift GraceB1

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2017 05:00PM kathy1925 wrote: I had bilateral breast cancer, and didn't feel any lumps. Routine mammogram showed calcifications in the right breast, which led to a diagnosis of DCIS. Only the pre-surgical bilateral MRI picked up a small lump in my left breast. This one was IDC, which led me to have a double mastectomy after already having a lumpectomy(right) and wide excisional biopsy (left). Six years out and doing great.
Posts.Title: How many of you felt a mass prior to getting tested? Hopefloatsagainandagain Cowboy-Up
